document_title: Arm lymphedema: Causes, treatment and prevention
subsection_content:
The cause is that lymph fluid cannot circulate normally. This comes from 2 main reasons:
Primary: This form is rare due to developmental disorders, usually occurring in the 20s; Secondary: Disease caused by another disease such as infectious disease (strep, worms) or damage from trauma caused by radiation therapy for cancer. Common types of cancer are breast cancer, prostate cancer, and lymphoma.
Arm lymphedema is a permanent sequela if not prevented, detected promptly and treated early.
